answerText: Pauli exclusion principle[10] The action of the exchange operator on a fermionic state yields this multiplicative factor, a fact that can be used to deduce the exclusion principle.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | Editors 1 | 18 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This principle states that identical fermions cannot simultaneously occupy the same quantum state. For 10 points each: [10] Name this principle from quantum theory that ensures electrons in the same orbital will have different spins.
